results.title: The Flight of the Gossamer Condor
results.creator_credit: Jacqueline Shedd, Shedd Productions and Ben Shedd
results.brief_description: The story of how Dr. Paul MacCready won the Kemer Prize for the first man-powered aircraft that could fly a mile long figure of eight course. Follows the inventor through twelve months of planning and disappointments as he develops his idea from the first crude wing into a sophisticated craft that flies the course.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacqueline Shedd, Shedd Productions and Ben Shedd

results.title: The Firm Man
results.brief_description: Businessman Gerald Barker is invited to join a mysterious super corporation known as The Firm. His work in the organisation turns out to be of a unique and somewhat disturbing nature. But Gerald finds no comfort with his wife Melissa and friend Barry - his relationships with both collapse. In a surreal and strange fashion, Gerald eventually comes to understand what The Firm is about. Made on a tiny budget of $15,000 the film is a mix of naturalism and stylisation which the filmmaker hoped would work on ‘a simple, surrealistic level’. An early film from the director of “The Year My Voice Broke”, “Mouth to Mouth” and “Far East”.

results.title: The Face of Lincoln
results.creator_credit: Wilbur T. Blume, University of Southern California and Edward Freed
results.brief_description: Professor Merrell Gage, head of the Department of Sculpture at the University of Southern California, describes the life and career of Abraham Lincoln as he sculptures from clay a life-like bust of the President, making physical changes in the subject’s face, hair, beard and expression to correspond with events in Lincoln’s life.

results.title: The English patient (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Minghella, Saul Zaentz and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Based on Michael Ondaatje’s Booker prize-winning novel, “The English Patient” is a sumptuous romance set during the second world war in the deserts of North Africa and the rolling hills of Tuscany. Hana (Juliette Binoche), a shell-shocked Canadian nurse decides to stay in an abandoned villa to nurse a mysterious English patient (Ralph Fiennes) who is burned beyond recognition and doesn’t remember his name. Gradually we learn the truth of his identity and of his doomed love affair with Katherine Mansfield (Kristen Scott Thomas). Winner of 9 Oscars at the 1996 Academy Awards, including Best Film, Best Director, Best Supporting Actress (Juliette Binoche) and Best Cinematography for Australian John Seale.

results.title: The England of Elizabeth
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Ian Ferguson, Edgar H. Anstey and John Taylor
results.brief_description: A.L. Rowse, the eminent historian, has written, “The Elizabethan Age is not something dead and apart from us…Wherever one goes in England there are visible memorials of what those men and women were when they were alive, houses they built, things they made and wore, objects they cherished, patterns they imposed upon the very landscape.” Some of the visible traces as well as something of the spirit of that England of Elizabeth I, Drake, Raleigh and Shakespeare, are recorded in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: British Transport Films, Ian Ferguson, Edgar H. Anstey and John Taylor

results.title: The Earthling
results.creator_credit: Peter Collinson, John Strong, Elliot Schick and Samuel Z Arkoff
results.brief_description: Patrick Foley, dying presumably of cancer, returns from America to his outback country town. There, after the briefest of conversations with long-lost acquaintances, he sets off over the mountains to a remote and hidden valley where his father once carved out a small farm. On his way, he comes accross Shawn Daley, who has just seen his mother and father die in a campervan accident. Lost, angry and afraid, Shawn seeks Patrick’s help but is coldly rebuffed. The irascible Patrick wants nothing to do with anybody else and tells the boy he must fend for himself. Shawn has no choice but to keep hounding Patrick, and the rest of the film is the changing relationship between this dying man and a dependent child. Cast includes William Holden, Ricky Schroder, Jack Thompson and Olivia Hamnett.

results.title: The Driver
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Lawrence Gordon, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Ryan O’Neal is the superstar getaway driver and Bruce Dern is the detective obsessed with capturing the speed maniac regardless of the costs. The Driver is well aware of the cop chasing him and leaves a tantalising trail of evidence in a game in which there can only be one victor. This film is notable for its high octane value, rather than a thoughtful character study with lots of dialogue. Cast also includes Isabelle Adjani as a gambler hired as an alibi for the driver.

results.title: The Drag
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and Carlos Marchiori
results.brief_description: Animated cartoon about a young man who becomes a chain smoker. Explains to young people the psychology of the smoking habit, including the part played by cigarette advertising.

results.title: The Dismissal
results.creator_credit: Terry Hayes, Kennedy-Miller, George Miller, Phil Noyce, George Ogilvie, Carl Schultz and John Power
results.brief_description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Hayes, Kennedy-Miller, George Miller, Phil Noyce, George Ogilvie, Carl Schultz and John Power
results.description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place. The events covered occurred over the period between 1972 and 1975 and have been arranged, in the film, into six parts. Cast: Peter Carroll, Bill Hunter, John Hargreaves, John Meillon, Max Phipps, John Stanton, Arthur Dignam, Ruth Cracknell, Nancy Hayes.

results.title: The Daydreamer
results.brief_description: An example of independent Melbourne film production. A young man watching a girl pass by his window, imagines himself the hero in a series of fantastic situations in which the maiden’s honour is threatened by diverse evil characters. Made by Michael Martin, assisted by Garry Martin, Bruce McNaughton and Doug Hobbs.
